meanings.definition: The act of taking action or carrying out a task.
meanings.sent1: Her actioning of the project impressed everyone in the team.
meanings.sent2: The actioning of the new policy brought positive changes to the company.
meanings.sent3: He was so focused on actioning the plan that he forgot to take a break.
meanings.sent4: The actioning of the rescue mission was like a well-coordinated dance.
meanings.sent5: The actioning of the emergency response plan saved many lives.

meanings.definition: The process of implementing or executing a plan.
meanings.sent1: The actioning of the strategy required careful coordination.
meanings.sent2: Effective actioning of the proposal led to successful outcomes.
meanings.sent3: The actioning of the project felt like solving a complex puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her actioning of the plan was as smooth as a flowing river.
meanings.sent5: The actioning of the new system streamlined operations efficiently.

meanings.definition: The act of performing a specific task or duty.
meanings.sent1: His actioning of the assignment was thorough and precise.
meanings.sent2: Teamwork is crucial for efficient actioning of tasks.
meanings.sent3: The actioning of his daily responsibilities made him feel accomplished.
meanings.sent4: The actioning of the experiment required attention to detail.
meanings.sent5: Her actioning of the role showcased her dedication and skills.
